summary: This is a letter from attorneys Michael C. Miller and Martin G. Weinberg, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the FBI's New York Field Office. The letter formally requests specific documents and records from the MCC related to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for their own investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC's Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

keyFacts: Attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein's estate are formally requesting specific evidence from the FBI/MCC related to his death, including video, logs, and protocols from August 9-10, 2019.
The request cites "serious irregularities" at the MCC and uncertainty around the cause of death, indicating the estate intends to conduct its own investigation.
Jeffrey Epstein died in the Special Housing Unit of the MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal charges.
Attorney General William Barr had publicly stated that Epstein's death raised serious questions and that there were concerning irregularities at the facility.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially declined to immediately release a determination on the cause of death, citing a need for further information.
